title: NASA Awards Contracts for NOAA Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications Study
summary: NASA, on behalf of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), has awarded four contracts to conduct NOAA’s Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications (SMBA) Phase-A study.

title: Firefly ready for call-up to launch military ‘responsive space’ mission
summary: Firefly Aerospace and Millennium Space Systems announced Aug. 30 that they are standing by waiting for orders from the U.S. Space Force to prepare to launch a mission to low Earth orbit.

title: TransAstra Secures NASA Contract, Partners With ThinkOrbital On Debris Capture Bag System
summary: TransAstra, a pioneering space logistics startup, has secured an initial contract from NASA to manufacture an innovative inflatable capture bag designed to tackle the growing problem of orbital debris.

title: Ariane 6 Hot Fire Test Postponed Again Due To Technical Issues
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) has revealed that a test-firing of the Ariane 6 core stage, originally planned for August 29, had to be postponed due to technical problems involving the control bench responsible for propellant loading and the automated countdown process.

title: Why did SpaceX give up on “catching” falling fairings? Its VP of launch explains
summary: "You basically had this really awesome algorithm, this crazy automation."
